channel.title: To dip, or not to dip, that is the question
channel.description:
Since Mopman is being a tard I shall ask our great community what they think of this combination!
any nuggets + shake (ice cream).
Dipping nuggets into shake (ice cream), good or bad?
Discuss!

item.title: To dip, or not to dip, that is the question
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

only thing imma dip is my balls in ya girls mouth

on a more serious note. i used to dip fries in frosty at wendys because their frosty is NOT A MILKSHAKE. but i was like 12 and now its really gross and oh my god you people are disgusting

Read full topic

item.title: To dip, or not to dip, that is the question
item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

http://the-sieve.com/2013/10/03/keepers-of-the-oil-the-miracle-of-frying/

Freeze a Twinkie. Skewer it, batter it, and dip it in the fryer. Instantly, hot oil performs its chemical baptism. Water vaporizes. Starch gelatinizes. Crust caramelizes. Spongecake puffs into an airy pillow; cream filling melts to vanilla ooze.

It’s pretty normal to dip your fries in your shake. Esp. Wendy’s frosty’s. I swear Wendy’s ran an ad-campaign about it over the summer one year, even.

But why would you dip a burger into a shake? That’d be gross as fudge.

item.title: To dip, or not to dip, that is the question
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

the nuggets are expensive too, and its arguably their shittiest, most-processed food on their menu.

If u want nuggets, get the chicken strips at burger king. Its real pieces of chicken and very crispy and delicious (assuming the handicapped workers cook it right)

Muroth:

i dip my fries into wendy’s frosties, but that’s the only time.

best thing at wendys is their chilli. I recently had a bad cold, and I ate chilli everyday to keep sinus clear lol.

Read full topic
